Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.roll

Class CourseRoll

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.roll.CourseRoll
public class CourseRoll extends Object
This class represents the CourseRoll object that holds the enrolled students in the course. It has the functionality of adding students to the roll or removing students from the roll. It can also check if the given student is appropriate to be added or removed from the roll.
Author:
Victor Hermida, Thien Nguyen

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    CourseRoll(Course c, int enrollmentCap)
    Constructs the CourseRoll object with the given enrollmentCap and create the empty LinkedAbstractList of Students.

    • CourseRoll

      public CourseRoll(Course c, int enrollmentCap)
      Constructs the CourseRoll object with the given enrollmentCap and create the empty LinkedAbstractList of Students.
      Parameters:
      c - course that goes into course roll
      enrollmentCap - roll's enrollment capacity

  • Method Details

    • setEnrollmentCap

      public void setEnrollmentCap(int enrollmentCap)
      Set the roll's enrollment capacity. Throw the IllegalArgumentException exception if the given parameter is less than minimum enrollment value or greater than maximum enrollment value.
      Parameters:
      enrollmentCap - roll's enrollment capacity
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if enrollmentCap is less than minimum enrollment value or greater than maximum enrollment value
      IllegalArgumentException - if enrollmentCap is less than number of currently enrolled students

    • getEnrollmentCap

      public int getEnrollmentCap()
      Returns the roll's enrollment capacity.
      Returns:
      the roll's enrollment capacity

    • getOpenSeats

      public int getOpenSeats()
      Returns the difference between the enrollmentCap and the size of the roll.
      Returns:
      the difference between the enrollmentCap and the size of the roll

    • enroll

      public void enroll(Student s)
      Add the given student to the CourseRoll. Throw the IllegalArgumentException exception if the given student is null, if there is no more room in the class, if the given student is already enrolled, or if adding the student to the LinkedAbstractList generates an exception.
      Parameters:
      s - student to be enrolled
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given student is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if there is no more room in the class
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given student is already enrolled
      IllegalArgumentException - if adding the student to the LinkedAbstractList generates an exception

    • drop

      public void drop(Student s)
      Remove the given student from the CourseRoll. Throw the IllegalArgumentException exception if the given student is null or if removing the student from the LinkedAbstractList generates an exception.
      Parameters:
      s - student to be removed
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given student is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if removing the student from the LinkedAbstractList generates an exception

    • canEnroll

      public boolean canEnroll(Student s)
      Returns true if the Student can be added to the CourseRoll and false if there is no more room in the class or if the given student is already enrolled.
      Parameters:
      s - student to be removed
      Returns:
      true if the Student can be added to the CourseRoll and false if there is no more room in the class or if the given student is already enrolled.

    • getNumberOnWaitlist

      public int getNumberOnWaitlist()
      Retrieves the number of students on the wait list
      Returns:
      the number of students currently on the wait list
